text: [Music]
hi this is Jim from AWS the topic of
this session is portfolio discovery and
analysis migration typically goes
through five phases evaluation planning
design migration and optimization the
discovery happens at the planning stage
portfolio discovery refers to a process
that generates IP inventory data about
applications servers metal devices and
storage which are already deployed in
customer data centers on-premise the
goal of portfolio discovery is to
produce prioritized backlog of
applications for migration the backlog
drives the iterative design and
migration in the subsequent phases in
the following we have to go through
types of portfolio data discovery tools
analysis of discovery data and
prioritization of application migration
IT portfolio can be comprised of
hundreds of data elements the data
elements are typically characterized as
application server network and storage
data let's walk through a few data
elements and see why they are required
for application data among the various
factors criticality determines the
priority of applications in the
migration backlog based on business and
technology drivers characteristics
describes application behaviors such as
state four of data less or whether
application is reassemble in case of
interruption this type of information
can be very important to migration
design stack will determine the grouping
of applications for migration for
example a web server a back-end
application and my sequel database may
form a three-tier web application they
are together for one wave of
raishin server data such as opting
system can see pu RAM and a disk will
determine the image type and VN size to
be used in the target cloud among the
network data firewall rules will be
implemented by ACL or security group in
a cloud for storage the capacity and the
utilization data will be used for
resource capacity planning during the
migration process here is an example of
requirements for portfolio data
collection some of them are mandatory
and some optional depending on specific
customer or environment as part of the
migration planning you shall specify
such requirements for portfolio
discovery from the vast amount of
portfolio data collected we need to
extract key pieces of information to
form a migration plan connections is a
critical piece it helps determine
application and the server dependencies
and also help identify access patterns
performance metrics is another factor to
help right-size resources in the cloud
another aspect is using service meaning
conventions
tags and other host metadata to help
identify patterns and group servers and
applications for migration the portfolio
discovery process should aim at
completeness and the usability if
additional data are required you need to
determine tools and actions to complete
discovery by now we have collected and
analyzed IT portfolio data and have
derived groups of applications next is
to prioritize the applications for
migration a number of factors may
determined application migration
priority here are three major factors
business critical
we can be determined by applications
business impact frequency views size of
user base etc to minimize business risks
perhaps you want to consider migrating
at least a business critical
applications first application
complexity can be characterized by
technology stack architecture or
dependencies between an application and
underlying infrastructure or
dependencies among multiple applications
along this dimension applications with
the least complexity may be migrated
first the third factor is environment
priority there can be different types of
environments for different purposes
migration priority may be given to
development and a test environment first
to start development work in a cloud
discovery automation is a key to
minimizing the migration planning time
tools are available to help automate a
discovery process and provide more
detailed information in a variety of
formats AWS provide application
discovery service a ds2 help systems
integrators quickly and reliably plan
application migration project in
addition as listed here several AWS
partners offer tools for portfolio
discovery and analysis as well in case
customer needs services support you can
find the discovery and planning service
partners at this aw AWS website how can
we pick up right tools for the portfolio
discovery and analysis here are few
factors we should consider when picking
a tool agent based and agent lists are
perhaps the most commonly described
implementation mechanisms employed in
discovery tools a gin-based discovery
refers to having agent software
installed on the machines or hosts that
require discovery
having an agent on the machines they
gave you more insights into the data on
the other hand the aging software needs
to be installed and maintained which
takes time and resources a journalist
methods does not require any software
pre-installed on the machines instead to
collect data a discovery server connects
to the machines using remote access
method such as SSH and the powershell
the agent list method requires
credentials to access the machines you
need to make a creative decision based
on the pros and accounts of these two
methods after all the customer owns the
portfolio data and may have requirements
on where the discovered data shall be
stored and how the data should be
protected even though most tools perform
dependency discovery they may be for in
terms of information abstraction some
tools may provide dependency data at the
server level sometimes those data can be
too granular or too noisy to identify a
migration groups some tools may provide
application level dependency data which
can be helpful to application grouping
performance discovery is a common
requirement the question is whether you
really need deep application or
infrastructure performance data the more
data the more collection time is a
trade-off visualization and the
reporting is another area for
consideration user interface with
effective virtualization and the
dependency graph manipulation capability
can be very important to data analysis
and migration planning so its report
generation with a variety of formats
like XML and CSV or ideally an API is
possible please note one evaluating
discovery tools you also need to know
constraints in the data center
and that may affect the use of certain
discovery tools for example are there
any restrictions on the type of port
that can be used for scanning we are on
premise security policies that you hear
administrative credentials if needed by
a tool to summarize we evaluate and
choose discovery tools based on the
needs for migration planning and we also
take into account customers requirements
and the environment constraints this
table shows several popular discovery
tools in comparisons with some of two
features we just give work some tools
may offer more features that others yet
may cost more it's a trade-off between
feature set and a tool cost among other
factors the takeaway from this session
is that discovery and analysis is
essential step prior to the migration
design phase furthermore discovery
automation is critical to migration
scheduled various tools are available
for discovery and that data analysis
thank you for watching
